docs.lead_paragraph: A senatorial odd couple -- the conservative Orrin Hatch and the liberal Edward Kennedy -- have come up with a bill that would cover up to half of the 10 million children who lack health insurance. The incremental plan will disappoint those who believe that no American child should go uninsured. But it offers a politically realistic step in a worthy direction. Perhaps three million uninsured children are eligible for Medicaid, the Federal program for the poor, but they remain unenrolled. The Administration has proposed providing money to the states to sign up more poor families. Most of the other uninsured children come from families too well off for Medicaid but too poor to buy private coverage.
docs.abstract: Editorial lauds bill sponsored by US Sens Edward Kennedy and Orrin Hatch, which would cover up to half of 10 million children who lack health insurance, as politically realistic step in worthy direction (M)
